postal_areas.name: Postal boundaries
postal_areas.meta: Postal area, district and sector boundaries with population counts. Largest geographical postal unit used to form the initial one or two characters of the postcode. Postal districts are the next geographical level from postal sector. The districts are made up of postal area characters followed by one or two digits. The sector is the third or fourth digit after the postal district or can be identified as the digit after the space in a postcode written in Royal Mail format.

catchment_editable.meta: Isochrones generated on the fly around a point.
catchment_editable.name: Catchments

competitors.meta: Dixons Carphone Warehouse significant competitor shops.
competitors.name: Competitors

poi.name: Points of Interest
poi.meta: A subset of collection of points of interest across the UK including healthcare locations, law and order sites along with sport & leisure facilities, car parks, cinemas and service areas.

retail_place_shopcent.name: Retail Place Shopping Centre
retail_place_shopcent.meta: Polygons of all shopping centres within the UK.
retail_place_shopcent.properties: rp_id, sc_name, rp_name, rp_type, unit_count, sc_type, area_curt

retail_pitch.name: Retail Place Pitch
retail_pitch.meta: Comparitive strength within Retail Place area. Hex grid created using Retail Place to determine ranking of each cell within the centre.

Retail pitch rank in decimal scale.label: Retail pitch rank in decimal scale

stations.meta: The stations that service underground lines, are part of the National Rail network or the Northern Ireland rail stations and support thirteen light rail systems within the United Kingdom.
stations.name: Rail stations

rail.name: Railways
rail.meta: The rail and light rail systems within the United Kingdom.

roads.name: Road network
roads.meta: The UKs motorways including all junctions, slip roads, stubs and spurs. All non-primary UK roads (trunk roads or otherwise, A-road). B-roads designated as carrying significant local traffic. Minor roads that are generally local. Minor roads that provide the most satisfactory route for through traffic between places of traffic importance, they are often but not always trunk roads.

seamless_town.name: Seamless towns and suburbs
seamless_town.meta: Seamless boundaries for towns and suburbs in the UK.

shoppertown.name: Shopper town
shoppertown.meta: 585 seamless shopper towns which are created by using true town centres.

admin_region.name: Local Authority Districts
admin_region.meta: Regions, counties and local authority districts of the UK.

work_place_hybrid_zone.name: Work place at hybrid zone
work_place_hybrid_zone.meta: 2015 worker counts, densities and occupation splits on hybrid zone level.
